metadata.Title: CVE-2023-38409 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in set_con2fb_map in drivers/video/fbdev/core/fbcon.c in the Linux kernel before 6.2.12. Because an assignment occurs only for the first vc, the fbcon_registered_fb and fbcon_display arrays can be desynchronized in fbcon_mode_deleted (the con2fb_map points at the old fb_info).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38409` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-23-generic - 6.2.0-23.23
linux-image-6.2.0-23-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-23.23
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-23-generic - 6.2.0-23.23
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-23-generic-64k - 6.2.0-23.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-aws - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-23.23').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
